original: Öberg, Sven Erhard, överste, Uddevalla, if. 8/1/96 i Frösö, Jämtl. 1., av trädg :konsul. Johan Ö. o. Lovisa Johansson. G. 28 m. Karin Rosén. Barn : Jan f. 30, Bengt 31, Sten 35. — Stud:-ex. 14. Fänrik v. Jämtl. fältjäg :reg. 16, kapt. v. gen :’staben 33, major 36, öv:-löjtn. v. Bohusl. reg. 41, överste o. chef där sed. 42. Kadettoff. v. KS 29-31, stabischef v. Övre Norrl. trupper 37-39, souschef i lantförsv. kommandoexp. 39-41. Styr:led. i Sv. o-ff :förb. Led. av div. komm. o. utredn. betr. pens:-, av-lön:- o. soc. frågor, stadsfullm. i Uddevalla sed. 42. KS02kl, RVO, FAKSM, LandstSM, Bohusl.-Dals bfb GM, Sthlms IfbSM, FFrK3kl m sv.
translated:
Öberg, Sven Erhard, Colonel, Uddevalla, born on 8th January 1896 in Frösö, Jämtland. 1st child of Consul Johan Ö. and Lovisa Johansson. Married on 28th with Karin Rosén. Children: Jan born in 1930, Bengt in 1931, Sten in 1935. 

Completed studies at age 14. Enlisted as an Ensign in the Jämtland Field Ranger Regiment in 1916, promoted to Captain in the General Staff in 1933, Major in 1936, Lieutenant Colonel in the Bohuslän Regiment in 1941, Colonel and Chief since 1942. 

Attended Cadet School from 1929 to 1931, served as Chief of Staff for the Upper Norrland Troops from 1937 to 1939, Deputy Chief in the Commanding Expedition for National Defense from 1939 to 1941. Board member of the Swedish Officers Association and member of various committees and investigations concerning pension, salary, and social issues. City councilor in Uddevalla since 1942. 

Recipient of the Order of the Polar Star 2nd Class, Royal Order of Vasa, Field Army Corps Silver Medal, Bohuslän-Dalsland Home Guard Federation Gold Medal, Stockholm Rifle Association Silver Medal, 3rd Class Medal of the Freemasons with swords.

medals.name: Bohuslän-Dalsland Home Guard Federation Gold Medal
3rd Class Medal of the Freemasons with swords
